alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 9:40AM MST until January 17 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow showers, locally heavy at times. Snow levels falling to 4500-5000 feet from west to east. Some snow showers reducing visibility to near zero at times. Additional snow ranging from less than an inch at lower elevations, to as much as 3 or 4 inches at the higher elevations. * WHERE...Areas above 5500 feet near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Chinle, Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Ganado, Grand Canyon, Heber-Overgaard, Jacob Lake, Kayenta, North Rim, Pine- Strawberry, Pinetop-Lakeside, Prescott, Shonto, Show Low, Valle, Williams and Window Rock. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to almost impossible at times. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Additional snow forecast from 9 AM Today to 11 PM Today: Alpine 1 to 2 inches Buffalo Pass 4 to 6 inches Chinle 0 to 1 inches Doney Park 0 to 1 inches Flagstaff 1 to 3 inches Forest Lakes 2 to 4 inches Ganado 1 to 3 inches Grand Canyon 1 to 3 inches Heber-Overgaard 0 to 1 inches Jacob Lake 2 to 4 inches Kayenta 0 to 1 inches North Rim 3 to 5 inches Pine-Strawberry 2 to 4 inches Pinetop-Lkside 2 to 4 inches Prescott 0 to 1 inches Shonto 0 to 1 inches Show Low 1 to 2 inches Valle 1 to 2 inches Williams 2 to 4 inches Window Rock 1 to 3 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
